alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:21PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO...NORTHWESTERN CHEYENNE COUNTY IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS AND SOUTHWESTERN DUNDY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN NEBRASKA THROUGH 445 PM MDT/545 PM CDT/... At 421 PM MDT/521 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Haigler, or 11 miles northwest of St. Francis, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northwestern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas and southwestern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska, including the following locations... Wheeler. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
